required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Vaginal Tactile Imaging in Assessment of Pelvic Floor Conditions

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators will analyze biomechanical transformation of pelvic floor tissues and support structures under affected pelvic floor conditions and repaired states after the surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Tissue elasticity change after the surgery measured as a gradient in tactile image. Unit of measure: mmHg/mm
primary_outcome.time_frame: pre-surgery and post-surgery (4-6 months after surgery) measurements
primary_outcome.description: Tissue elasticity is measured for entire anterior and posterior compartments

primary_outcome.measure: Pelvic floor muscle strength change after the surgery measured as a pressure dynamic feedback during muscle contractions. Unit of measure: mmHg
primary_outcome.time_frame: pre-surgery and post-surgery (4-6 months after surgery) measurements
primary_outcome.description: Muscle strength is measured during voluntary and involuntary muscle contractions, involuntary relaxation and Valsalva maneuver.

study_pop.textblock: Patients scheduled for pelvic floor surgery

facility.name: The Institute for Female Pelvic Medicine and Reconstructive Surgery

patient_data.ipd_description: Scientific Publications of the study results
